parameters.description: Order by field (email, status, created_at, expires_at, role_name, inviter_name)
parameters.name: order_by

parameters.description: Search term to filter by inviter or invitee email
parameters.name: search

get.description: Accept an invitation to join an organization

post.description: Resend an existing invitation or create a new one if expired

get.summary: Get logged in user profile information

post.description: Create a new permission in the system

Associates a permission with a role
Associates a role with a user in an organization
Removes a permission with a role
Removes a role with a user in an organization

delete.description: Delete an existing role if it has no associated users

get.description: List User sessions for provided userId
get.summary: List User session for provided userId

delete.description: Revokes a specific session by session ID

post.description: Authenticate user with password and issue jwt token
Reset the password with the password reset token sent to email
post.summary: Reset the password with the password reset token sent

post.description: Get password reset token to email

get.description: Lists the users for an organization

put.description: Activate a user in the organization
Deactivate a user in the organization

delete.summary: Revoke all user sessions except current

get.description: Returns whether a given username has WebAuthn credentials registered (for login UI flow decisions).
get.summary: Check if user has WebAuthn credentials

get.description: Returns all registered WebAuthn credentials for the authenticated user.

delete.description: Removes a registered WebAuthn credential by ID.

post.description: Starts the WebAuthn authentication ceremony. Pass username for credential-bound login, or omit for discoverable (passkey) login.
Completes the authentication ceremony, validates the authenticator response, and issues a JWT.
Starts the WebAuthn registration ceremony for the authenticated user. Returns a CredentialCreationOptions JSON for the browser.
Completes the registration ceremony by validating the authenticator response and storing the credential.

authenticatorAttachment.description:
AuthenticatorAttachment If this member is present, eligible authenticators are filtered to only
authenticators attached with the specified AuthenticatorAttachment enum.

requireResidentKey.description:
RequireResidentKey this member describes the Relying Party's requirements regarding resident
credentials. If the parameter is set to true, the authenticator MUST create a client-side-resident
public key credential source when creating a public key credential.

residentKey.description:
ResidentKey this member describes the Relying Party's requirements regarding resident
credentials per Webauthn Level 2.

userVerification.description:
UserVerification This member describes the Relying Party's requirements regarding user verification for
the create() operation. Eligible authenticators are filtered to only those capable of satisfying this
requirement.

id.description: CredentialID The ID of a credential to allow/disallow.

transports.description: The authenticator transports that can be used.

id.description: A unique identifier for the Relying Party entity, which sets the RP ID.

name.description:
A human-palatable name for the entity. Its function depends on what the PublicKeyCredentialEntity represents:

When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity it is a human-palatable identifier for the Relying Party,
intended only for display. For example, "ACME Corporation", "Wonderful Widgets, Inc." or " ".

When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity, it is a human-palatable identifier for a user account. It is
intended only for display, i.e., aiding the user in determining the difference between user accounts with similar
displayNames. For example, "alexm", "alex.p.mueller@example.com" or "+14255551234".

displayName.description:
A human-palatable name for the user account, intended only for display.
For example, "Alex P. Mller" or " ". The Relying Party SHOULD let
the user choose this, and SHOULD NOT restrict the choice more than necessary.

id.description:
ID is the user handle of the user account entity. To ensure secure operation,
authentication and authorization decisions MUST be made on the basis of this id
member, not the displayName nor name members. See Section 6.1 of
[RFC8266](https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn/#biblio-rfc8266).

name.description:
A human-palatable name for the entity. Its function depends on what the PublicKeyCredentialEntity represents:

When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity it is a human-palatable identifier for the Relying Party,
intended only for display. For example, "ACME Corporation", "Wonderful Widgets, Inc." or " ".

When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity, it is a human-palatable identifier for a user account. It is
intended only for display, i.e., aiding the user in determining the difference between user accounts with similar
displayNames. For example, "alexm", "alex.p.mueller@example.com" or "+14255551234".
